page.title: 03Dodford
page.content: In August 1975 Dodford village was made into a conservation area. The majority of the Chartists' plots are still there. Church Road, Victoria Road and Woodlands Road still are very narrow with hawthorn hedges. Each plot of land is 4 acres. Several Chartist bungalows still exist though some have been altered slightly and modernised inside. When the Chartists lived there the main crop was strawberries (on the clay soil) but now grass is the main crop, for hay and grazing for horses. No trees or hedges cna be cut down in Dodford.
